elements.description:
Note: put this in a flyout for now. We just need to build it to get feedback on it.
  I formatted this with markdown to illustrate formatting. Not sure how to confirm formatting (or should it even be specified?)
elements.name: Can see classification guide me info

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the guide me option

arguments.content:
# Classification
  The results of the classification questions are designed to protect information and ensure that it is tracked, reviewed, and distributed appropriately. Information owners/custodians are responsible for determining the sensitivity of their information. Follow [Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI)](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/sbmsearch/SubjArea/InfoProtect/categories.cfm), SBMS procedures, and/or consult with a Derivative Classifier: The proposal’s metadata and associated documents will be private until pushed to the external proposal system of record. This means that only active ORNL personnel that are invited within the managed roles, within the review process, and within line management have access. Once the information is pushed to the external proposal system of record, access will modify to incorporate other internal and external personnel within the proposal workflow.

  # Official Use Only and Export Controlled Information
  It is the responsibility of each ORNL personnel to be aware of and understand any export control requirements related to their work according to the applicable laws and regulations. When sharing Export Controlled information, ensure recipient parties (especially foreign nationals) are authorized to receive it. Determine if entered information might be Export Controlled by using the [Export Control Decision Tool](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/SBMSearch/subjarea/export/tool.html). For additional guidance, follow the  [SMBS procedures](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/SBMSearch/subjarea/export/sa.cfm), vist the [Export Control Website](https://ornl.sharepoint.com/sites/ornl/ec/Pages/ExportControl.aspx), and/or consult with an Export Control Analyst.

  Information within the proposal or proposal package falls within the scope of an [Official Use Only (OUO)](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/SBMSearch/subjarea/InfoProtect/exhibitCUIPCMan.cfm) topic in the Classification Guide, Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI) Guideline, or in program-issued OUP guidance, the document is considered OUO. For other documents, the OUO responsibility falls to the author/owner of the information. For additional guidance, review [RHSI](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/sbmsearch/SubjArea/InfoProtect/categories.cfm) to help you make a determination, or consult with a Derivative Classifier.

  To be identified as OUO, information must be unclassified and meet both of the following criteria

  > Damage: Have the potential to damage governmental, commercial, or private interests if disseminated to persons who do not need the information to perform their jobs or other DOE-authorized activities. The possible consequences to such interests should be carefully considered in each case.

  > Freedom of Information Act (FOIA): [FOIA Exemptions](https://www.foia.gov/faq.html#exemptions) (exemptions 2 through 9; information falling under exemption 1 can never be OUO because it covers information classified by Executive order). These exemptions describe types of information whose unauthorized dissemination could damage governmental, commercial, or private interests.

  # Classified Subject Areas
  Any information that falls within a [Classified Subject Area (CSA)](https://sbms.ornl.gov/sbms/SBMSearch/subjarea/InfoProtect/exhibitClassMan.cfm#CSAs) has the potential to be classified or other restrictive classification level. If your project/task or respective information falls within a CSA, consult with a Derivative Classifier before uploading/entering information, and checked by a Classification Officer prior to release.

description:
In order to get information about facilities
  As the researcher
  I want to see the facility contact

  This feature also includes allowing the researcher to indicate who specifically they've contacted.
  This is important to help indicate to the facility that the research is appropriate for the facility,
  the facility has capacity and any costs for using the facility are accounted for in the proposal.

  Facility Recommended Contact
  Main point of contact for the facility. Can be the initial contact and point the researcher to someone who can
  give more specialized help if needed.
  This person is static for each facility across all proposals.

  Facility Actual Contact
  The researcher is required to to indicate who they've contacted about the use of the facility. This could be the main
  point of contact if no one more specific was needed.
  This person is indicated by the researcher for each proposal.
  This person can be consulted during reviews to confirm the facility is aware of the proposals potential work.

arguments.content:
Work performed in a user facility can be either:
* **Proprietary**: If your research results will be kept private, then facility usage must be charged at full cost recovery, including machine time.
* **Non-proprietary**: If your research results are published, there is no cost for machine time or facilities that are fully-funded by DOE.

steps.name: you will see work details

elements.name: Can see cost details

steps.name: you are looking at the facilities page

arguments.content:
In addition, user facilities may be:
* **DOE fully-funded**:  If your research is non-proprietary, there is no charge for use of facilities that are fully-funded by DOE.
* **Partially-funded or unfunded**:  Facilities that are not fully-funded by DOE must charge on a full cost recovery basis.
* **Incremental Costs**: If usage exceeds normal hours and services of the facility, incremental costs may apply.

description:
In order to vet my proposal
  As a researcher
  I want to enter my proposal in RES

  Note: In this feature, the following vocabulary is defined:
  - a proposal is considered "valid" if all the fields required to save the proposal are in a completed or an acceptable state
  - a proposal is considered "invalid" if any of the fields required to save the proposal is in an incomplete or unacceptable state
  - a proposal is considered "existing" if it has been saved at least once (and has therefor been assigned a valid id)
  - a proposal is considered "new" if the first save has not yet occurred, if it has not been specified "valid", then it is completely blank

description:
In order to vet a proposal early
  As a researcher
  I want to select the correct subtype for my proposal

  The subtype is informed by sponsor. Meaning the sponsor picked will
  greatly influence the options available for subtype.
  A Federal sponsor means that federal is the only subtype available for the proposal.
  A non federal sponsor means that federal can't be selected.
  Determining between Non-Fed/CRADA is the hardest selection and will officially be determined during the SPPS review process.
name: Select SPP/CRADA type (subtype)

description:
In order to have a solicitation evaluated by the SPA office
  As the researcher
  I want to provide details about the solicitation

  Some proposals are in response to a solicitation released by a government agency. The SPA office will need to evaluate the solicitation
  to determine if ORNL is eligible to work on a proposal based on the solicitation.
name: Provide solicitation details
